title: Boot USB Thumb Drive when the bios does not support USB Boot

forumNotes.author: e2p2
forumNotes.content: I have a number of older servers that have usb ports but the bios does not support booting from any USB connected device, CD-ROM or Thumb Drive. Does any one know of a way to setup a floppy it chainload/boot from a connected thumb drive?

forumNotes.author: was_jaclaz
forumNotes.content:
> I have a number of older servers that have usb ports but the bios does not support booting from any USB connected device, CD-ROM or Thumb Drive. Does any one know of a way to setup a floppy it chainload/boot from a connected thumb drive?

Sure ![:D](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/biggrin.png), search the board for keyword "PLoP" (without quotes).  

Check the homepage:  
[http://www.plop.at/](http://www.plop.at/ "External link")  
[http://www.plop.at/en/bootmanager.html](http://www.plop.at/en/bootmanager.html "External link")  
[http://www.plop.at/e...mngrusblog.html](http://www.plop.at/en/bootmngrusblog.html "External link")  

then, depending on WHAT OS you want to boot from USB, you ***may*** need some additional methods.
